width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>mL</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="0.200 molar open parenthesis, C H 3, close parenthesis, 2, N H aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.200</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>NH(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> with <math alttext="100 decimal point milliliters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>100.</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>mL</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="0.200 molar open parenthesis, C H 3, close parenthesis, 2, N H aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.200</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>NH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>Cl</mtext><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> and claims that if a small amount of strong base is added to the mixture, then the resulting change in <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>200.</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>mL</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="0.200 molar open parenthesis, C H 3, close parenthesis, 2, N H aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.200</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>NH(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following best explains whether or not the studentâ€™s claim is correct?

choices.label: The claim is correct because the mixture contains only half of the <math alttext="open parenthesis, C H 3, close parenthesis, 2, N H aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>NH(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> that the <math alttext="0.200 molar open parenthesis, C H 3, close parenthesis, 2, N H aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.200</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>NH(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> contains. The lesser amount of base in the mixture makes the <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>p</mtext><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of the mixture lower than the <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>p</mtext><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of the <math alttext="0.200 molar open parenthesis, C H 3, close parenthesis, 2, N H aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.200</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>NH(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>; therefore, when a small amount of strong base is added, the change in the <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>p</mtext><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of the mixture will be smaller than the change in the <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>p</mtext><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of the <math alttext="0.200 molar open parenthesis, C H 3, close parenthesis, 2, N H aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.200</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>NH(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The claim is correct because the mixture contains a significant amount of the acid <math alttext="open parenthesis, C H 3, close parenthesis, 2, N H 2 with a positive 1 charge aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>NH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>, which can react with and partially neutralize the added strong base, thereby reducing the change in <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>p</mtext><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. In <math alttext="0.200 molar open parenthesis, C H 3, close parenthesis, 2, N H aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.200</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>NH(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>, the concentration of the acid <math alttext="open parenthesis, C H 3, close parenthesis, 2, N H 2 with a positive 1 charge aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>NH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is very small; therefore, the added strong base is not neutralized and the change in <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>p</mtext><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> will be larger.

The claim is incorrect because the mixture contains only half of the <math alttext="open parenthesis, C H 3, close parenthesis, 2, N H aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>NH(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> that the <math alttext="0.200 molar open parenthesis, C H 3, close parenthesis, 2, N H aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.200</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>NH(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> contains. The lesser amount of base in the mixture makes the <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>p</mtext><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> of the mixture lower than the <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>p</mtext><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> of the <math alttext="0.200 molar open parenthesis, C H 3, close parenthesis, 2, N H aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.200</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>NH(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>; therefore, when a small amount of strong base is added, the change in the <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>p</mtext><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> of the mixture will be larger than the change in the <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>p</mtext><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> of the <math alttext="0.200 molar open parenthesis, C H 3, close parenthesis, 2, N H aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.200</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>NH(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The claim is incorrect because the change in <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>p</mtext><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> resulting from the addition of a small amount of strong base to the mixture and to the <math alttext="0.200 molar open parenthesis, C H 3, close parenthesis, 2, N H aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.200</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>NH(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> will be the same given that the same amount of strong base is being added to the same volume of solution.

content.answer: The claim is correct because the mixture contains a significant amount of the acid <math alttext="open parenthesis, C H 3, close parenthesis, 2, N H 2 with a positive 1 charge aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>NH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>, which can react with and partially neutralize the added strong base, thereby reducing the change in <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>p</mtext><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. In <math alttext="0.200 molar open parenthesis, C H 3, close parenthesis, 2, N H aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.200</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>NH(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>, the concentration of the acid <math alttext="open parenthesis, C H 3, close parenthesis, 2, N H 2 with a positive 1 charge aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>NH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is very small; therefore, the added strong base is not neutralized and the change in <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>p</mtext><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> will be larger.

skill.text: 6.D: Provide reasoning to justify a claim using chemical principles or laws, or using mathematical justification.
